author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Of oil demand that wanes, a tale I weave,
Round Odin's call, swift chariots to leave,
E'er more of Thor's fierce bolt, this age shalt seek,
The gods resound, their flames to quench man's reek.

To Shell, the wise, their reward now comes hither,
Share Loki's laugh as mortals grasp and slither,
In Jotun's gold they find their highest call,
Whilst bound to waning flame, they'll rise and fall.

And now of Brent, like waves Ægir broods,
Hesitation mists, awaiting call from Fed,
Between the serpent's jaws, the path unclear,
Inflation's menace doth relentlessly leer.

feedItems.title: Oil Demand to Peak This Decade, IEA Says
feedItems.description: Rising demand for crude oil is set to slow to a trickle within five years and peak before the end of the decade, as electric-vehicle uptake surges and developed nations rapidly transition to cleaner sources of energy.

feedItems.title: Shell to Lift Dividend, Launch $5 Billion Buyback
feedItems.description: The energy major Shell said it will share billions more from its record profits with investors while deepening its commitment to the oil-and-gas businesses that produce the highest returns. .

feedItems.title: Brent Inches Higher Ahead of Federal Reserve Meeting
feedItems.description: Oil futures were little changed in Europe as investors awaited the latest Fed rate decision, with the central bank “caught between a rock and a hard place” regarding inflation, said Commodity Research Group.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of campus denunciation and strife,
Where comfort finds discordant tale,
Methinks we ought consult the ale,
To soothe the wounds of daily life.

FTSE riseth, as the monks their wine,
As traders weigh the GDP,
Eager for the interest decree,
A brew of markets and quaffs divine.

In Virginia Tech the speech doth ring,
Students deemed as vile conservatives,
Professors spew their invectives,
Pray, in Heaven's name, let ale hearts sing.

feedItems.title: The Comforts of Campus Denunciation
feedItems.description: Hear some talk that you dislike?

feedItems.title: FTSE 100 Rises as Traders Weigh UK GDP Data, Await US Rate Decision
feedItems.description: The FTSE 100 edged up early in the session, as traders reacted to U.K. economic growth data and looked ahead to the Fed interest rate decision.

feedItems.title: Notable & Quotable: Speech at Virginia Tech
feedItems.description: ‘When students filed this current lawsuit, a Virginia Tech tenured professor took to Twitter to publicly call the students ‘conservative s—tbags’ who were ‘suing the school because they’re bigots.’ ’

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Of Trump's indictment, readers engage,
In law's domain, carelessness or sage?
A crime without a wounded soul,
Such quandary fills the parchment scroll.

In young minds, gender's woes reside,
Alarm can harm, yet oft misguide.
Transient be this path they tread,
A phase of search; not fate's firm thread.

Lest Russia fall in disarray,
A chance for China, some may say,
In chaos seek stability,
But not at cost of equity.

feedItems.title: How to Think About the Trump Indictment: Readers Debate
feedItems.description: A reckless disregard for the law or another victimless crime?

feedItems.title: Alarmism Hurts Children With Gender Dysphoria
feedItems.description: For many minors, this may be a transient phase of exploration rather than a permanent identity.

feedItems.title: If Russia Loses, Don't Let China Win
feedItems.description: Russian instability could be an opportunity for the Chinese.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Within the halls of knowledge vast,
Where questions asked and answers cast,
The challenge met, and wisdom gleaned,
From students' minds, true understanding weaned.

Sad tidings from the Naspers bower,
Their earnings, once in bloom, did cower,
Sore losses from the dragon's lair,
As Tencent's profit falls to thinning air.

Two knights, with banners raised anew,
To contest for honor, tried and true,
As voices raised in protest sang,
In fateful contest, on the winds they hang.

feedItems.title: Examples Are the True Test of Learning
feedItems.description: They challenge students to demonstrate that they understand the concept.

feedItems.title: Naspers Warns on Earnings
feedItems.description: Naspers said it expected to report a 26%-33% fall in core earnings per share for 2023 and 2024, mostly due to lower profit contributions from its associates, China’s Tencent in particular.

feedItems.title: A Slogan for a Biden-Trump Rematch in 2024
